description: The adjective is derived from archive (“place for storing earlier, and often historical, material; material so kept, considered as a whole”, noun) +‎ -al (suffix meaning ‘of or pertaining to’ forming adjectives).
The noun is derived from archive (“to put (something) in an archive”, verb) +‎ -al (suffix forming nouns, especially of verbal action).

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to an archive or archiving.
Of a material: having a quality suited to the conservational needs of archiving.
(uncountable) The practice of storing items in an archive; archiving; (countable) an instance of this.
examples: Our nightly computer backups include the archival of old e-mail messages.
